intro: Gynocampus, commonly known as the golden cup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. The leaves are usually opposite and may have a velvety texture. Gynocampus species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
